references.paper_title: Towards a general-purpose foundation model for computational pathology
references.reason: This paper introduces a general-purpose foundation model for computational pathology, which is the basis for the proposed method in this paper.

references.paper_title: A visual-language foundation model for computational pathology
references.reason: This paper introduces a vision-language foundation model that enables the extraction of more meaningful and discriminative features for downstream WSI analysis applications, which is directly leveraged in this paper.
This paper introduces an attention-based MIL model, a key component of the proposed framework for WSI analysis in this paper.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, which bridges visual and linguistic modalities and is used in this paper to extract concepts from the pathology VLM.

references.paper_title: Representation learning with contrastive predictive coding
references.reason: This paper introduces contrastive predictive coding, which is used in this paper to design the CIB module and enhance the task-relevant characteristics while suppressing irrelevant information.
